intro: Chaetanthera moenchioides var. pauciflora, commonly known as the slender moonflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its fragrant, white, star-shaped flowers that open at night. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and thrives in sandy soils. It has slender, climbing stems and small, oval-shaped leaves. Due to its limited flower production, it is considered a rare and delicate species.
